txt.en: 'You've done it! Thank you, [placeholder]; you have saved the Lithe Festival!'
'Oh, time is running out!'
Stocking the Pond
This looks like an excellent fishing spot
'The drum are biting this year, [placeholder], but they are only available in the summer. Catch them while you can!'
Collected amberjacks ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
'The drum are biting this year, [placeholder], but they are only available in the summer. Catch them while you can!'
This looks like an excellent fishing spot
The fish that best represent the dwarves can be found inside of Thorin's Hall.\n\nYou should go to Thorin's Hall and collect fish for the Lithe Festival.
'The luillim, one of our favourite fish, are very plentiful this year. Many of my folk like nothing better than to sit by the docks and wait for the fish to take the bait.'
Collected luillim  ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
The fish that best represent the dwarves can be found inside of Thorin's Hall.\n\nYou should go to Thorin's Hall and collect fish for the Lithe Festival.
'The luillim, one of our favourite fish, are very plentiful this year. Many of my folk like nothing better than to sit by the docks and wait for the fish to take the bait.'
This looks like an excellent fishing spot

The fish that best represent those loved by the Elves can be found by fishing along the docks of Celondim, in Ered Luin.\n\nYou should gather fish from Celondim to help supply the Lithe Festival in the Shire.
'I need fish, and lots of them, from all over, if this festival is to be a success! You must hurry!'
Collected drum ([placeholder]/[placeholder])

The fish that best represent those loved by the Elves can be found by fishing along the docks of Celondim, in Ered Luin.\n\nYou should gather fish from Celondim to help supply the Lithe Festival in the Shire.
'Goodness! Time is running out! Have you been to Bree yet?'

The fish that best represent those loved by Men can be found by fishing at the Pond, near Pierson's farm to the south of Bree-town.\n\nYou should gather fish from Bree to help supply the Lithe Festival in the Shire.
'Goodness! Time is running out! Have you been to Bree yet?'
'I need fish, and lots of them, from all over, if this festival is to be a success! You must hurry!'

The fish that best represent those loved by Men can be found by fishing at the Pond, near Pierson's farm to the south of Bree-town.\n\nYou should gather fish from Bree to help supply the Lithe Festival in the Shire.
'I know the Elves love fish also! Will you gather some from their waters?'
Neddie Grubb awaits your diverse collection of fish in Bywater, in the Shire.\n\nYou should bring the fish to Neddie Grubb so that the pond can be properly stocked for the Lithe Festival.
Neddie Grubb awaits your diverse collection of fish in Bywater, in the Shire.\n\nYou should bring the fish to Neddie Grubb so that Bywater can be properly stocked for the Lithe Festival.
'I know the Elves love fish also! Will you gather some from their waters?'
'The amberjacks that have been biting of late have provided us with ample fine meals this summer!'
'The amberjack that have been biting of late have provided us with ample fine meals this summer!'

Look for the best place to catch drum
Collect drum from the pond ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Talk to Neddie Grubb in Bywater
Talk to Neddie Grubb in Bywater
Talk to Neddie Grubb in Bywater

The Lithe Festival has started, but without enough fish in the pond, it will surely be a disaster.\n\n<rgb=#FF0000>NOTE: This quest will be removed from your quest log when the current festival ends.</rgb>

'This is just terrible! The Lithe Festival has started, but we don't have enough fish in the pond for the derbies!

'Wait... if each person I let fish for the festival brings some fish, then this will all work! This will not be the last event they put me in charge of! And you -- yes, you! -- you're going to help make sure of that.

'Run off to the far lands of the Elves, Men, and dwarves and bring me back some fish!'
